y.algo
Class Trees

java.lang.Object
  y.algo.Trees

public class Trees
extends Object

Provides diverse algorithms and services for tree-structured graphs or subgraphs.

Method Summary

Method Detail

getTreeEdges

public static EdgeList[] getTreeEdges(Graph graph)
Returns an array of EdgeList objects each containing edges that belong to a maximal directed subtree of the given graph.

Parameters:
graph - the given graph.
Returns:
an array of EdgeList objects each containing edges that belong to a maximal directed subtree.
See Also:
getTreeNodes(y.base.Graph)

getTreeEdges

public static EdgeList[] getTreeEdges(Graph graph,
                                      NodeList[] treeNodes)
Same as getTreeEdges(Graph) but more efficient if the treeNodes where calculated before by getTreeNodes(Graph). Furthermore, the method can also be applied to the result obtained by getUndirectedTreeNodes(y.base.Graph). In this case the subtrees are considered to be undirected.

Parameters:
graph - the given graph.
treeNodes - An array of NodeLists formerly calculated by getTreeNodes(Graph).
Returns:
an array of EdgeList objects each containing edges that belong to a maximal subtree.

getTreeNodes

public static NodeList[] getTreeNodes(Graph graph)
Returns an array of NodeList objects each containing nodes that belong to a maximal directed subtree of the given graph. For each list of tree nodes the first node element is the root of a tree. On each such root all outgoing edges connect to nodes in the subtree and each root's indegree is at least two.

Parameters:
graph - the given graph.
Returns:
an array of NodeList objects each containing nodes that belong to a maximal directed subtree.

getUndirectedTreeNodes

public static NodeList[] getUndirectedTreeNodes(Graph graph)
Returns an array of NodeList objects each containing nodes that belong to a maximal undirected subtree of the given graph. For each list of tree nodes the first node is the only node of the subtree that may be incident to non-tree edges.

Parameters:
graph - the given graph.
Returns:
an array of NodeList objects each containing nodes that belong to a maximal undirected subtree.

isNaryTree

public static boolean isNaryTree(Graph g,
                                 int n)
Checks whether the given graph is a directed rooted tree where each node has a maximum of n children.

Parameters:
g - the given graph.
n - the allowed maximum of children.
Returns:
true if the given graph is a directed rooted tree where each node has a maximum of n children. Otherwise, the method returns false.

isRootedTree

public static boolean isRootedTree(Graph g)
Checks whether the given graph is a directed rooted tree. Note: isRootedTree(graph) => isTree(graph).

Parameters:
g - the given graph.
Returns:
true if the given graph is a directed rooted tree. Otherwise, the method returns false.

isTree

public static boolean isTree(Graph g)
Checks whether or not the given graph is an undirected tree. Note: isRootedTree(graph) => isTree(graph).

Parameters:
g - the given graph.
Returns:
true if the given graph is an undirected tree. Otherwise, the method returns false.

isForest

public static boolean isForest(Graph g)
Checks whether the given graph is a forest, that is, a graph whose connected components are directed rooted trees.

Parameters:
g - the given graph.
Returns:
true if the given graph is a forest. Otherwise, the method returns false.

isForest

public static boolean isForest(Graph g,
                               boolean directedRootedTree)
Checks whether the given graph is a forest. If directedRootedTree == true each component has to be a directed rooted tree. Otherwise, each component has to be an undirected tree. Note: isForest(graph, true) => isForest(graph, false).

Parameters:
g - the given graph.
directedRootedTree - whether to check for directed rooted trees.
Returns:
true if the given graph is a forest. Otherwise, the method returns false.

getLeafNodes

public static NodeList getLeafNodes(Graph tree,
                                    boolean directedRootedTree)
Returns all leaf nodes of the given tree. A leaf node is a node with outdegree == 0 if the input is a directed rooted tree, and a node with degree == 1, otherwise.

Parameters:
tree - the given tree.
directedRootedTree - whether or not to consider the tree as directed rooted tree.
Returns:
a NodeList that contains all leaf nodes of the given tree.

getCenterRoot

public static Node getCenterRoot(Graph tree)
Returns the center node of an undirected tree. The center node has the property of inducing a minimum depth tree when being used as the root of that tree.

Parameters:
tree - the given undirected tree.
Returns:
the center node of the given undirected tree.
Preconditions:
!tree.isEmpty()
isTree(tree)

getRoot

public static Node getRoot(Graph tree)
Returns a possible root for the given (undirected) tree. More precisely, if the input is a directed rooted tree or reversed directed rooted tree it returns the corresponding root node. Otherwise, if the input is a tree, the method returns a maximum weight center node as defined in getWeightedCenterNode(y.base.Graph). If the input is not a tree, the node with indegree == 0 (or outdegree == 0) is returned.

Parameters:
tree - the given tree.
Returns:
a possible root for the given tree.
Preconditions:
isTree(tree) or there is exactly one node with indegree == 0 or there is exactly one node with outdegree == 0
!tree.isEmpty()

directTree

public static EdgeList directTree(Graph tree)
Reverses some edges of the given tree such that it is a directed rooted tree afterwards. A list of all reversed edges will be returned by this method.

Parameters:
tree - the given tree.
Returns:
an EdgeList that contains the reversed edges.
Preconditions:
The given graph must be a tree.
!graph.isEmpty()

getWeightedCenterNode

public static Node getWeightedCenterNode(Graph tree)
Finds a node which is used by the greatest number of all (undirected) paths interconnecting all nodes with each other.

Parameters:
tree - the given tree.
Returns:
a node which is used by the greatest number of all undirected paths.
Preconditions:
The given graph must be a tree (may be undirected).
!graph.isEmpty()

getWeightedCenterNode

public static Node getWeightedCenterNode(Graph tree,
                                         NodeMap intWeight)
Finds a node which is used by the greatest number of all (undirected) paths interconnecting all nodes with each other. The number of paths per node are stored in the given NodeMap.

Parameters:
tree - the given tree.
intWeight - a NodeMap that is used to store the number of paths per node.
Returns:
a node which is used by the greatest number of all undirected paths.
Preconditions:
The given graph must be a tree (may be undirected).
!graph.isEmpty()

directTree

public static EdgeList directTree(Graph tree,
                                  Node root)
Reverses some edges of the given tree such that it is a directed rooted tree with the given node as root element. A list of all reversed edges will be returned by this method.

Parameters:
tree - the given tree.
root - the given root element.
Returns:
an EdgeList that contains the reversed edges.
Preconditions:
The given graph must be a tree.
The given node must be part of the given graph

getNearestCommonAncestor

public static Node getNearestCommonAncestor(Graph tree,
                                            Node root,
                                            boolean rootedDownward,
                                            NodeList nodes)
Returns the nearest common ancestor of a subset of nodes within a directed rooted tree. It is not part of the given subset.

Parameters:
tree - the given directed rooted tree.
root - the root of the tree.
rootedDownward - whether the tree is directed from the root to the leaves (true) or from the leaves to the root (false).
nodes - the subset of nodes.
Returns:
the nearest common ancestor of the given subset of nodes.
Complexity:
O(tree.N())
Precondition:
isTree(tree)

getSubTreeDepths

public static void getSubTreeDepths(Graph tree,
                                    NodeMap subtreeDepthMap)
Returns for a rooted directed tree the depths of each of its subtrees.

Parameters:
tree - a rooted directed tree graph.
subtreeDepthMap - node map that will hold for each node the depth of the subtree rooted at it. The resulting depth values can be retrieved using the map method NodeMap.getInt(Object).

getSubTreeSizes

public static void getSubTreeSizes(Graph tree,
                                   NodeMap subtreeSizeMap)
Returns for a rooted directed tree the size (number of nodes) of each of its subtrees.

Parameters:
tree - a rooted directed tree graph
subtreeSizeMap - node map that will hold for each node the size of the subtree rooted at it. The resulting size values can be retrieved using the map method NodeMap.getInt(Object).
